intro: Heterotropa sugimotoi, commonly known as the Sugimoto's heterotropa, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four petals and prominent stamens. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
